decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Location Plan, FB-23, FB-24]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until the existing projecting sign advertisement shown on plan ref: 10.2 are removed in their entirety and the land made good to the same condition as the adjacent land.  
Reason: To prevent the retention of advertisement hoardings shown to be removed, in order to achieve an acceptable effect on the appearance and amenity of the location in accordance with Council Policy LP9 of the Local Plan. 
Condition : 3 - The maximum steady brightness of the fascia sign hereby permitted is not to exceed 400 candelas per sq.m.
Reason: To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy LP9 and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023.
Condition : 4 - The illumination of the sign hereby permitted shall be by static illumination only. 
Reason: In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with Council policy LP9 and to comply with paragraph 132 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE:  You are advised that the painting of the shopfront shown on the drawing may require planning permission under the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 for which a separate application would be required.
description: Display of internally illuminated projecting sign.
